question: Which two tools can be used for conditional route matching in Cisco IOS? (Choose two.)
options: Standard ACLs
Prefix lists
Extended VLAN lists
Static routes

question:
Refer to the configuration snippet:

```
ip prefix-list PRIVATE-NETS seq 5 permit 10.0.0.0/8 le 24
ip prefix-list PRIVATE-NETS seq 10 deny 0.0.0.0/0 le 32
```

What does this prefix list accomplish?
options: Permits all routes up to /24 under 10.0.0.0/8 and denies all other prefixes
Denies all private IPv4 ranges up to /24
Permits any prefix shorter than /24 under 10.0.0.0/8 and allows the default route
Applies conditional forwarding for default traffic
correct_answers: Permits all routes up to /24 under 10.0.0.0/8 and denies all other prefixes

options: True

question: Which of the following correctly describes the components of a route map?
options: Prefix number, match statement, permit/deny, and tag
Sequence number, conditional match criteria, processing action, and optional set action
ACL reference, routing table, and administrative distance
Interface type, protocol ID, and next hop
correct_answers: Sequence number, conditional match criteria, processing action, and optional set action

question:
Refer to the exhibit.

```
route-map PBR permit 10
 match ip address 101
 set ip next-hop 10.23.1.3
!
interface GigabitEthernet0/0
 ip policy route-map PBR
```

What is the effect of this configuration?
options: Forwards all packets to 10.23.1.3 regardless of destination
Forwards packets matching ACL 101 to next-hop 10.23.1.3
Applies PBR globally to the router
Applies PBR only to outbound traffic
correct_answers: Forwards packets matching ACL 101 to next-hop 10.23.1.3

question: Which keyword allows a route map used for Policy-Based Routing (PBR) to set a next-hop address only when the destination does not exist in the routing table?
options: set ip default next-hop
set next-hop conditional
set ip fallback next-hop
match default route

question:
Refer to the exhibit.

```
router ospf 1
 redistribute eigrp 100 subnets metric-type 1 tag 20
```

What does this configuration accomplish?
options: Redistributes all EIGRP routes as OSPF Type 1 external routes with tag 20
Redistributes only classful EIGRP routes as OSPF Type 2 routes
Redistributes only internal EIGRP routes into OSPF area 0
Blocks EIGRP routes from being redistributed into OSPF
correct_answers: Redistributes all EIGRP routes as OSPF Type 1 external routes with tag 20

question: Which two statements are true regarding seed metrics in redistribution? (Choose two.)
options: A seed metric is automatically applied when redistributing between similar protocols
A seed metric defines the starting cost for redistributed routes
A seed metric is not required for BGP redistribution
A seed metric determines the AD of redistributed routes
correct_answers: A seed metric defines the starting cost for redistributed routes
A seed metric is not required for BGP redistribution

question:
Refer to the exhibit.

```
router bgp 65001
 redistribute ospf 1 match external 1 external 2
```

What is the purpose of this command?
options: Redistributes only internal OSPF routes into BGP
Redistributes both Type 1 and Type 2 OSPF external routes into BGP
Redistributes all OSPF routes including connected networks
Redistributes only NSSA routes into BGP
correct_answers: Redistributes both Type 1 and Type 2 OSPF external routes into BGP

question: What is the main cause of routing loops during multipoint redistribution between OSPF and EIGRP?
options: Mutual redistribution without route tagging
Mismatched seed metrics between routers
Missing subnets keyword in redistribution
Incorrect redistribution direction (in vs out)

question:
Refer to the exhibit.

```
route-map TAG-EIGRP permit 10
 match ip address 10
 set tag 100
!
router ospf 1
 redistribute eigrp 100 route-map TAG-EIGRP
```

What is achieved by this configuration?
options: Prevents redistribution of tagged routes into EIGRP
Marks redistributed EIGRP routes with a tag of 100 in OSPF
Converts EIGRP external routes to OSPF Type 1 routes
Creates route feedback prevention between OSPF and EIGRP
correct_answers: Marks redistributed EIGRP routes with a tag of 100 in OSPF

question: Which two methods can be used to prevent routing loops during redistribution between multiple protocols? (Choose two.)
options: Apply unique route tags per redistribution point
Modify administrative distance values
Disable route summarization on all routers
Use ACLs to filter all external routes
correct_answers: Apply unique route tags per redistribution point
